name.text: 10.2.9 (Example of finding equation of tangent line)

questiontext.text:
Example

Find the equation of the tangent to \(f(x) = x^2+1\) at the point where \(x = 1\).

Solution

Since \(f(1) = 1^2 +1 = 2\), the point where the tangent touches the curve is \((1,2)\). Now, \(f'(x) = 2x\) so at \(x = 1\), \(f(1) = 2\), thus the gradient at the of the tangent at the point is \(2\). Therefore, using the formula above, the tangent has equation \[ y = 2(x-1) +2 \implies y = 2x \]
